ReferenceDocuments.name: This measure identifies a per
ReferenceDocuments.description: This measure identifies a person's ability to connect to other types of individuals in their life/society.  Assessing a person's connectedness to others who hold specific resources (e.g., skills, knowledge, prestige, authority) is considered a standard way to measure the kind of social capital that individuals can access for routine and unusual circumstances/needs. Each of the two 'generators' tap into different kinds of social network resources which are considered social capital.

DataElement.changeDescription: Changed from caBIG to PhenX for PANH by script 2015-12-21
